file_content.text: Affirmative.
My eyes are always scanning for trouble. my lord.
It's simple moments like this when I'm most sure the Empire will prevail.
My lord. I have settled into my quarters and fully acquainted myself with the ship. I am at your disposal.
I want you on a persistent state of alert, Captain.
Be ready at all times.
I won't disappoint, my lord.
You don't have to be so formal, Quinn.
Loosen up.
I am more at home saluting than shaking hands, my lord. And even more in my element behind the helm.
I am fully trained in all aspects of operating this vessel. I can navigate and pilot it to perfection.
I should probably inspect those quarters, Captain.
[Flirt] I'll be the judge.
You'll find them spotless and in order, my lord.
You'll also find that I am fully trained in all aspects of operating this vessel. I can both navigate and pilot.
If you're half as good at evading obstacles as you are my advances, then my ship is in good hands.
[Flirt] You dodge well, Quinn.
I'm here to do a job, my lord.
I'm not sure what to do with you, Quinn.
What good are you?
I volunteer for any and all duties, my lord. I hope you'll find my military acumen useful.
And I am completely familiar with this vessel and can both navigate and pilot.
Get to your station, then.
Good.
Right away, my lord.
You'll have to prove yourself, Captain.
I'll be the judge.
I'm ready, my lord.
You'd better come in handy in the field as well.
I hope you're ready to fight.
I look forward to showing you what I'm capable of, my lord.
My lord, after all we've been through--the good and the bad--I am dedicated one hundred percent to you and your legacy.
I find myself thinking about the future. I look forward to training your disciples and perhaps our children some day.
Are you debating whether or not to have children with me, Malavai?
Perhaps?
I want nothing more. If you desire it, it will be. I am ready.
Keep your mind on the present, Malavai.
No daydreaming.
Yes, of course. The seeds of the future are sown in the present.
Your guidance will be a source of strength.
That's good, Captain.
Our bond makes me stronger. I will ensure that your legacy will stand the test of time.
My legacy is yours as well, Malavai.
Our legacy.
You always know how to make me smile.
I want to be the most powerful Sith who has ever lived.
Only the best will do.
It will be my sole purpose.
Start by getting back to work.
Not by talking, you won't.
Of course, you're right.
It goes without saying that I will impart whatever skills and knowledge I can on your future disciples.
So, don't say it. It is your job, after all.
It does go without saying.
Right. But, for me, it's more than a job--it is a pleasure, and an honor.
You're too kind. Serving you and ensuring your legacy is a privilege.
If I deem it advantageous.
Perhaps.
My plans for you go beyond service, Quinn. You will father my children.
And on our offspring.
Of course, my lord. Call on me in whatever capacity you see fit.
I'll take no more of your time.
I have something very important to ask you.
My time is valuable. This had better be worth it.
Better be important.
I'll let you judge.
Let's tie the knot, Quinn.
Marry me.
Ha. I should have known. It's difficult to surprise someone with such acute senses.
I accept. And together, there will be nothing we can't achieve.
I'm all ears.
Please do.
There's nothing we can't achieve together. I'd be honored if you would marry me.
I'll marry you, Quinn.
Yes.
In light of our new commitment, perhaps you should start calling me "Malavai."
Submit the request through standard protocol. In triplicate.
I'll take it under advisement.
When we're alone, fine. Around others, I will continue to call you Captain Quinn.
Not in public.
That goes without saying.
Your captain will return to duty now. Malavai will see you later.
I'll just call you "husband." How's that?
Why stop there?
Please do not.
Or maybe "hubby."
I know better than to take you seriously. I'm going back to work. Wife.
As skilled and strong as you are, you're just an Imperial officer. My eyes are bigger than that.
You're not that guy to me.
Yes, sir.
I trust you'll understand if from now on, I dedicate myself solely to my professional responsibilities around here.
Just keep in mind that my quarters will always be open to you.
We'll see about that.
I understand, my lord.
You're old news anyway.
Fine with me.
You will do whatever I say. That means being available for my every whim. Is that clear?
That's not alright.
I suppose it is.
Am I dismissed?
Back to work with you.
Yes.
If you're through, you may go.
Have you said all you wish?
I'm definitely through. My lord.
I didn't intend for you to get hurt.
Sorry.
I like things as they are.
We don't need marriage.
I see. As you wish, then.
I'll go back to my duties. My lord.
The credit is yours, Quinn.
Thanks to you.
I plan on taking advantage of it, Captain.
Superb.
Your pride is unsightly. Muzzle it.
Stop bragging.
My lord, standard systems checks are all clear. The ship and crew are operating at peak efficiency.
What about you, Quinn? Are you operating at peak efficiency?
[Flirt] You included?
Say it so only I can hear.
Whisper, then.
With pleasure....
Keep this triviality to yourself. Is that all you're about--work? Don't you want something more?
Shut up and make me smile.
There's so much more. But it's better saved for private.
Give me a discreet taste.
Be subtle.
Perhaps I can restrain myself....
Be bold, Quinn. I don't date squeamish men.
Now or never.
We're so busy, the opportunity for privacy may not present itself for a while. Must not be very important.
If you can wait, fine.
No. I'll give you the thesis statement....
Glad to know. Dismissed.
Noted, Captain.
How long will you persist in this? Shall I move forward as though there's nothing between us?
Of course not. Just flexing my stubborn muscles.
No.
That's good to hear. I hope you find this equally welcome....
Take your best guess.
What do you think?
Fine. Since I'm already dangling, I'll go out on a limb....
I'm falling in love with you. What's more, I think you're falling in love with me. Am I wrong?
I feel the same, Quinn.
You're not wrong.
Now we've said it, later we'll show it.
If you're lucky, you'll hear me say something similar some day.
I'll keep you guessing.
Then I hope to be lucky.
Until then.
Haha! I've just been toying with you, Quinn.
You're wrong.
You've heard me. Do with it what you will.
I dismissed you, didn't I?
Yes.
That you did. My lord.
Is there another Moff out there you want to assassinate?
That's very generous, Quinn.
I'm touched.
This is inappropriate. Why are you spending your hard-earned credits on me, Captain?
You shouldn't buy me gifts.
I'm fielding reports from across Imperial forces. Among the men, there's universal relief that Moff Broysc is no more.
The rest of the Empire was passive. It sickens me.
They should have acted.
I was guilty of that for a long time.
It doesn't matter what others think. He needed to die.
Who cares?
I agree completely.
I'm sure that eases your conscience.
I'm glad.
I do not feel conflicted in the least. Not about anything. Including you.
I thought I'd die of old age waiting around for you.
It's about time.
You were too slow out of the gate, Quinn. Pursue me if you must.
I'm hard to get now.
I know you're only testing me.
Oh really? But how can you be sure?
I won't tolerate being teased. You'd better be serious.
I don't want to play games.
I don't play games, my lord. You should know that by now....
Lead the way.
Your presumption insults me. Go away.
No.
You'll play whatever game I say.
You'll play.
I went too far, Quinn. I don't want you to give up on us.
I didn't mean it.
Let's discuss this further. In my chambers.
I said go away. You run this ship and that is all there is between us. Understand?
Fine.
This should be good for a laugh.
I'm curious.
I'll return to my post. I hope to see you off duty again soon.
There's no doubt you will.
Count on it.
Perhaps the mood will strike me again.
We'll see.
Hmm. You switch gears remarkably quickly, my lord.
Keep your mind on your work.
Be in the moment, Captain.
You, as well.
You can bank on that, Quinn.
Guaranteed.
The jury's out. I'll let you know what I think some day.
We'll see.
Move on, Captain. There's work to do.
You through?
My lord, I've returned. I found Moff Broysc on a pleasure barge. He was on R & R while countless battles are raging. Despicable.
I abducted him and brought him here to present to you.
Scab! Traitor! You, Sith, I commandeer your ship, your crew. I commandeer you! Mine now.
Do you see who has bettered you? The man you wronged has you dead to rights now.
Look upon Quinn, madman.
No. Never. Not possible. I shunned him. I exiled him. He was to waste away!
Such a shame. He's completely lost his mind.
A sad sight.
Close that trap of yours, Broysc.
Shut up.
You are my men now! I command you all! Kill! Kill yourselves! I have spoken!
My lord, I've resisted all along, but this is personal. Permission to execute the Moff.
By all means. The kill should be yours.
Granted.
As you command.
I will not order it. Do you hate him enough to take responsibility for this?
You must decide, not me.
I believe I do.
You cannot kill me! You are nothing! I am a Moff!
You're not a ruthless killer, Quinn. Don't start now. Allow me.
I'll do it.
No. Sith, no! Admiral, I exonerate you, now kill the Sith! I am your commanding officer!
Not anymore.
No! Scabs, all scabs...!
You've out done yourself.
Good job.
You mean you couldn't bring yourself to kill him.
So you wimped out.
Explain your thinking.
Why bring him here?
I order you to kill Moff Broysc, Captain. Immediately.
You have it.
I will not order it and absolve you. Take responsibility for your hate and have your vengeance.
No, it must come from you.
You're not a murderer, Quinn. You don't have it in you. I'll do it myself.
I'll kill him.
The body has been disposed of, my lord. No more of Moff Broysc's men will have to endure his whims and incompetence.
The Empire is better for it.
It was the right thing to do.
My sentiment exactly.
Don't belabor the moment. Let's move on.
Get over it.
Yes, my lord. What's past is past.
You earned it.
Anything for you.
The Empire is better off now.
Captain, do you have news? How have your efforts with Imperial High Command gone?
Not well, my lord. I've gone as high up the chain as I can. No one will confront Moff Broysc. He's too powerful and entrenched.
He will serve until he's killed or willingly steps down. And he will never willingly step down.
Nice to know you're ready to do what needs to be done.
Now you're talking.
This is no different than any other problem. A Sith doesn't care if he's a Moff. Why not kill a Moff?
Use deadly force.
I agree Broysc should be confronted. But killing him should only be the last resort.
Remain open-minded
This is your calling, Quinn. Get to it.
I am ready, my lord.
My lord, Moff Broysc's holotransmissions have increased. They are beginning to disrupt operations.
He's nearly incoherent--I can only assume some sort of dementia has set in.
I have him on holo right now. I believe it's going to take your personal touch to assuage the situation.
Patch him through.
Fine.
I'll handle your difficulties so you can return to your primary responsibilities.
If you can't handle it....
Let me see this idiot for myself.
He's starting to annoy me.
Here he is, my lord....
...flew the coop! Your new cage will be smaller and tighter! Coffin size! Urn size! In a locket I'll wear around my neck!
He's unlikely to stop, my lord. He didn't even know he was on hold.
Druckenwell proved my point! My glory is mine! Mine! You're nobody!
Moff Broysc, I'll have a word with you.
Excuse me.
What! Who transfered me? I see a Sith! Rodjnik! I'll station you on Balmorra, too! Get that insubordinate fool back! Now--
The man has lost all sense.
He's deranged.
As I said.
[Remain quiet]
Where's my blaster? I'll shoot your face! Personally! And again! Druckenwell won't save you!
I could blow Balmorra away! I'll blow Balmorra away this time!
Wait! What? Gone? Where'd he--there's a Sith on this! Why did you transfer me, Rodjnik? I'll ship you off to Balmorra too!
Rodjnik, am I through? I'm through? Yes or no? I don't see--is this broken? All I see is a Sith!
Broysc, calm yourself!
Shut up!
How dare you--wait... you. It was you who liberated the admiral! Have you lost your mind?
You see a Sith because you have called my ship.
Your eyes do not deceive.
Your ship? I was talking to--wait, you're the one who dared to liberate the admiral! Have you lost your mind?
It's like a space collision--you can't help but watch.
This is entertaining, Quinn.
Wait now. I'm understanding this. It was you, Sith, wasn't it? You dared to liberate the admiral! Have you lost your mind?
He calls me Admiral Malcontent. He seems to think that's my actual rank and name.
Don't you know he's the one who lost the Battle of Talay?
Broysc's earliest command. Before I was born.
It was his blunder that allowed the escaped Jedi targets to flee Taris before the bombardment!
Ancient history. Broysc wasn't even born.
He sabotaged the Glory Space Station for crying out loud!
I have no idea what that is.
I hear him! I'm talking! His insubordination is lethal! Paralyzing! It threatens the Empire! And you do nothing!
Broysc, you are unfit for command. You compromise the Empire. I beg you to resign.
Listen to me, you need help.
I'm whole, Sith! Just passionate about this scourge that threatens us all! Once it is eradicated, we'll all be fine!
You need to be muzzled, madman. Locked away before you do serious damage.
You are a lunatic.
You will not defy me! Fight his disease, Sith!
Save yourself and deliver him to me for execution! Now! Are you listening?
Admiral Malcontent, I strip you of your rank and relegate you to the cleaning crew!
[Lie] He will be punished!
Yes, my lord.
A good start, Sith. But his crimes must be punished by death!
I order you to deliver him to me for execution! Immediately! Now! Are you listening?
I'll get right on that.
[Lie] Whatever you say.
Never too soon. I'll await your arrival. Exclusively. Broysc out. Rodjnik, how do I end this--
Quinn, end the transmission.
This is senseless.
Right away.
He must be ended once and--
I do not accommodate lunatics!
You don't order me!
Then I accuse you alongside him! Rodjnik, cut transmission! I said cut it now!
With Broysc in command, the Empire is in critical danger.
I must implore High Command to do something about him.
That's sound thinking, Quinn.
You do that.
I'll update you when I can.
If there's anything I can do to help, I will.
I'll corroborate.
A prepared statement would be beneficial. Thank you.
I need this off your plate, Captain. As quickly as possible.
Let them handle it.
Absolutely, my lord.
My lord, I've been dealing with a situation that's getting out of hand.
Moff Broysc contacted the ship and was incensed to find me at the helm. He's been sending recorded messages that are progressively more nonsensical.
He's always been scattered and aggressive--but now he seems completely unhinged.
The next time he comes calling, I will speak with the man.
Patch him through to me.
I would appreciate that, my lord.
He hates you, Quinn. And now he finds that you're flourishing again.
It's understandable.
It plagues me if I am the reason he's become unbalanced.
Who cares if some incompetent Imperial is losing it?
Why does it bother you?
The consequences could be severe. And if his preoccupation with me is to blame....
Tens of thousands of soldiers and some of our most critical campaigns are at the mercy of his commands.
The man is a liability.
Broysc is bad news.
I find myself agreeing with you.
Don't let him push your buttons, Captain.
It's not our concern.
I will try, my lord.
Nice to see your dander up. I wonder where it will take you.
I like you angry.
I just hope the man comes to his senses.
My lord, I've just been informed that I have passed the trials for captain, second grade.
I'm happy for you, Quinn.
Congratulations.
Thank you, my lord.
What do you want, a medal?
So?
I don't believe a medal accompanies the distinction, my lord.
Stick with me, you'll be a Moff someday.
Just the beginning.
As long as I continue to serve you, my lord.
I don't seek acknowledgment; it requires your approval to go into effect.
Consider it done.
I approve.
It's a wonder the military gets anything done in a timely fashion. Speed it through, Captain.
Insufferable red tape.
Very good, my lord.
I'll approve your upgrade when I feel you've earned it.
Then, you're at my mercy.
Very well. I hope to earn that distinction soon, my lord.
My lord. Thank you for your attention. I must officially request to be reassigned.
Not going to happen.
Denied.
My lord, I must speak freely, then.
Why in the galaxy would I want that?
Not a good idea.
For the sake of you and the crew.
I am compromised. Thoughts of you have begun to... distracted me.
Is this assignment too harrowing for you, Captain?
Can't take the heat?
No. I thrive on harrowing.
But I am compromised. I'm forced to admit that thoughts of you have begun to... distract me.
My feelings affect my ability to concentrate. I cannot, in good conscience, continue to serve.
All that tension will dissolve away if you just give in to your feelings.
[Flirt] Let go of your stress.
If we were involved, we might not be able to act, if the other's life would be forfeit.
No matter what we become, I will have no problem should that scenario present itself.
Speak for yourself.
Then we will leave this unexpressed. But you will remain in my charge. If you decide to grow some guts, you know where to find me.
You're probably right.
Our feelings will make us so strong, nothing can threaten us.
We will be invincible.
If you insist on reassignment, it will be a shame, but I'll grant it.
Are you sure you want to go?
No. I'm an idiot. Permission to kiss you, my lord.
You never need to ask.
Anytime.
Ah, you were building to it so nicely and then you blew it. I thought you were the type of man who had the confidence to act, not ask.
How disappointing.
If you can't take it, Quinn, I'll deposit you back on Balmorra to rot and never give you another thought.
Are you a man or a rodent?
You can watch the HoloNet for news on the real action.
I'm going to kiss you now, my lord.
[Let him]
My interest has waned. Perhaps it will return some day, who knows.
Forget it.
You are dismissed, Captain.
I'm the one who does the kissing around here, Captain.
At attention! [Kiss him]
Now, more than just duty and honor will be driving my work.
You are still my underling, and you will do what you are told with extreme professionalism.
Nothing has changed.
You will always have that, my lord.
That was just a taste. There's much more to come.
Drive fast.
I'm counting on it.
You'll see, passion will make you stronger.
You won't regret it.
I am growing open to the idea, my lord.
My lord, I am applying to receive the trials for the rank of captain, second grade.
I formally submit a request for your recommendation.
It would be an honor. I will sing your praises, Captain.
Certainly.
You honor me, my lord.
You will succeed or fail on your own credentials. Not my influence.
Forget it.
You're right. Thank you, my lord, your wisdom is considerable.
My time is valuable. Write up whatever you want and I'll sign it.
I'm busy--you draft it.
That wouldn't be ethical, my lord. I'll make do without a recommendation. Thank you.
My lord, returning from action. Pleased to report, Major Ovech and most of his officers have been saved.
I was able to infiltrate Ovech's starship and seize control of the operating systems.
I identified where his men were being held, freed them and locked Moff Broysc's occupying force on the bridge. Ovech's men promptly rescued him.
The Moff must be pitching a fit. How does it feel to thwart your nemesis?
Broysc can't be pleased.
My lord, I merely ensured that a great asset of the Empire wasn't squandered. Nothing more.
Amazing job, Quinn. I'm thankful you're on our side.
You're a genius.
You're too kind, my lord.
The Empire is stronger with Major Ovech. It would have been a shame if he was squandered.
Thank you for the opportunity. I'll return to my duties.
Spare me the details, Captain, and get back to your duties.
Not interested.
Immediately, my lord.
My lord, I was able to clear the channel and get to the bottom of Major Ovech's relays.
He's in a state of emergency. Patching him through now.
He's proven himself invaluable to me on many occasions.
Quinn is the best.
Wish I still had him in my detail. Probably would have avoided this.
He still has a long way to prove himself to me.
I'm reserving judgment.
Maybe my problem will be an opportunity for him do just that.
I don't know what this is about.
Start from the beginning.
Well, let me tell you the horror story.
Moff Broysc dispatched me and my officers to a secret weapons warehouse on Cato Neimoidia. Trouble is, it ain't a secret no more.
We're holed up, surrounded by Republic forces. Trying to get Broysc to send the rest of my unit, but he's gone radio silent.
It's worse than that, my lord. The major's ship has been commandeered by Broysc's personal commandos and ordered to stay put.
That tears it. Seen it a hundred times with Broysc. Better to cut bait and let good soldiers die than admit a mistake.
Sounds more like Broysc wants you dead, Major. Any idea why?
I think you've been set up.
Same reason he demoted and exiled your Captain, I'm guessing. I'm his only officer who's not shy about my opinion.
Most people in power are driven by ego over integrity.
Typical.
Broysc wrote the handbook on that.
I find it hard to believe that Broysc is so blatantly corrupt.
Pretty farfetched.
Well, the proof's got me buttered, breaded and in the skillet.
Enemy was pausing between breaths. Gearing up to charge again.
Looks like the end of the line for me. But I'm not going out without a fight. Ovech out!
My lord, Major Ovech would be a terrible loss. I served on his ship, know it like the back of my hand.
I can infiltrate and try to restore command to his men. Then they would be free to join the fight.
Why are you still standing here? Go!
Get on it.
Yes, my lord!
Fine, do what you will, but you're pulling double duty when you return.
You owe me.
Whatever you decide. Goodbye, my lord.
You're going to take on an entire troop of commandos alone?
All by yourself?
A frontal assault would take too long and risk losing or damaging the ship. My plan is to infiltrate and liberate.
I'll give you a full report when I return!
My lord, I've been tracking a series of broken Imperial signals on an encrypted channel.
Tremendous interference. I've identified the source--Major Ovech, commander of Moff Broysc's elite infiltrator unit--but that's all.
Strange, that name continues to pop up.
Moff Broysc again?
Yes, Moff Broysc oversees a large proportion of Imperial forces.
Who is this Major Ovech? Have you heard of him?
Do you know the major?
I know him well, my lord. Served with him under Moff Broysc for many years. He's an unmatched leader.
Is there any reason I should care about this?
Why does this concern me?
If you value my instincts.
I served with Major Ovech under Moff Broysc. The man is an unmatched officer.
Moff Broysc's command ship does not respond when hailed. My gut says there's trouble. Permission to investigate further?
I know you wouldn't waste time with anything that wasn't important.
Of course.
Thank you, my lord.
Your compulsiveness is exhausting, Captain.
Makes no difference to me.
Could be indigestion--or perhaps the acidic bile that's been bubbling in there over Moff Broysc, hmm?
I don't trust your gut.
I fail to see the correlation.
Frankly, I'm offended at the insinuation.
I insinuate what I please. You don't get offended, Captain.
How dare you.
Unless this turns out to be dire, I don't want to hear about it again.
Then I hope there will be no further updates.
So testy. Try to relax, I'm just having some fun.
Down, boy.
Since you're so wound up, pursue this as you see fit.
Sorry, my lord. And thank you.
Don't be offended, embrace it.
I approve of such motivation.
Stick your nose in this Moff's business. See if you can instigate a confrontation, I'm all for it.
I'll just try to learn if there's anything troublesome. But thank you.
My lord, you've caused me some difficulty, and I'd like to confirm that it was unintended.
Forgive me if I'm mistaken, but some time ago it seems you expressed an interest in me beyond our professional relationship.
I've left you tossing and turning in your bunk at night, have I?
Can't sleep?
In a manner of speaking. Which is why I bring it up.
It's called flirting, Quinn, look into it.
It was an icebreaker.
The more interesting question is why it's caused you difficulty.
I consider it outside the spectrum of accepted military communication.
I'll admit, you have a knack for... surprising me. I'm typically swifter on my toes.
I should have immediately said that any personal involvement between us could cloud judgment and compromise your campaigns.
I like taking risks.
Let's find out. [Kiss him]
I've given it no further thought. A momentary amusement, that's all.
Oh, that. No big deal.
Ah. Then all is well. Forget I brought it up.
Now that you mention it, I think the idea of you and me bears more consideration.
But on second thought....
You do? I mean, I see.
My lord, I... such an entanglement could cloud judgment and compromise your campaigns. I believe we should refrain.
I order you to kiss me. Now.
I command otherwise.
It's forgotten.
Done.
Then I will... return to my duties.
Does it occur to you that I may have been hurt by your earlier rejection?
You're so insensitive.
That hadn't occurred to me. My lord, it was not my intention to hurt you.
It's just difficult to become entangled with a superior. It could cloud judgment and compromise your campaigns.
Let's cut through this. I order you to kiss me, Captain.
What if it was a command?
My lord... yes, my lord.
This... my lord, I am drawn to you, make no mistake. But this should not continue. It's improper.
It's the impropriety that makes it so exciting.
But fun.
To be continued, Captain.
I'm in no rush, Quinn.
We'll take it slow, then.
I enjoy making you uncomfortable, Quinn. Keeps you on edge. Sharp.
Look at you squirming.
You have a talent for it, my lord.
As always, your reasoning is impeccable.
You make sense.
But know that I'm interested. When you feel more comfortable, I'll be here.
You've given me much to think about, my lord.
I'll just return to my duties, then.
If your spine is so weak, perhaps my interest has been misplaced.
How cowardly.
You are dismissed, Captain.
Yes. Yes, my lord.
My lord, I'm receiving reports of a failed military incursion.
It seems one of our special ops battalions was following shaky intel and walked into an ambush.
We're the only ship in the sector that can relay their distress calls to high command. Permission to transmit their coordinates for extraction.
Do it. Immediately.
Granted.
If they deserve to live, they'll save themselves.
It's not our concern.
I see. It's difficult for me to sit idly by when the consequences of a mistake can be lessened.
But your command has been exemplary. I do not question it.
I'll return to my duties.
I don't care either way.
Yes, my lord. Hopefully the consequences of this blunder can be lessened.
My lord, I seek advice. The Talz Broonmark acknowledges no one but you. It makes him difficult to command, and a wild card in battle.
Not since serving Moff Broysc have I had to deal with such an unpredictable variable.
You are a consummate officer, Quinn. You run this crew impeccably. I'm sure our Talz brute recognizes that.
You can handle Broonmark.
I hope you're right, my lord.
You can't stop thinking about your former superior, Quinn.
You're obsessed with Broysc.
You're very not flexible, are you, Captain?
Are you a control freak?
My job is to eliminate as many uncertainties as possible.
My lord, I seek advice.
As a military man, above all else, I value discipline, the chain of command, and uncompromising dedication to serving the Empire's interests.
But there's a built-in dilemma. When my instincts tell me that a superior is jeopardizing the Empire, it makes my path less clear.
Do you have a problem with my leadership, Quinn?
Are you referring to me?
No, my lord, you mistake me. My concern is about the legacy of my former commander.
That's the problem with the military. No matter what rank, no one should be above reproach.
Always speak your mind.
That has been a difficult lesson to learn. But it's tricky. The criteria to challenge a superior must never be softened.
You must always support your betters, Captain. The Empire depends on strict adherence to military code and hierarchy.
Never forget your place.
That was my mantra when I began my service. And I only challenge it in extreme circumstances.
I stood by as Moff Broysc's random whims compromised countless missions. It is a mistake I refuse to repeat.
Defying him ruined my career, but I should have done it sooner. No matter the consequences.
You're seething with hatred for him. I can feel it--you'd like nothing better than to exact revenge
You despise him.
If he made you this tenacious and exacting, you owe him a great debt.
You should thank him.
That is a startling perspective, my lord.
Your example and guidance give me clarity. Thank you. I am more focused now.
I have no complaints about your thoroughness or commitment.
Your focus is not in question.
I'll never give you reason to, my lord.
As long as you meet your responsibilities to me, your preoccupations are inconsequential.
Whatever you say.
As it should be.
Don't lie. I can feel your seething hatred. You crave revenge.
You can't fool me.
Revenge is a great motivator--yet it often clouds judgment.
If anyone caused me half as much trouble, I'd dedicate my life to bringing him down.
He should pay.
I have no aspirations for personal glory--just glory for the Empire, and now for you.
I know what I know, Quinn. And I encourage you to seek revenge.
Let go of denial.
I'm not sure how to respond, my lord. I will ruminate on it.
You've given me much to ponder.
Your service to me should consume you.
Good.
Every waking moment, my lord.
I won't take up any more of your time.
If you say so, I really don't care.
Fine, fine.
Which is why I must speak up when I'm concerned. And Broonmark is a challenge to me.
I'll make sure he knows you speak for me.
I'll talk to him.
Much appreciated, my lord.
If everything was knowable and controllable, Quinn, we'd grow lazy.
Challenges drive us to excel.
You're probably right, my lord.
Are you telling me that this is bigger than you, Captain?
You can't handle it?
Just bringing it to your attention. If you're not concerned, I'm not either.
I will not bother you about this again.
Then I won't take up any more of your time.
My lord, system checks are all optimal. The ship is ready for anything.
Good, then maybe there's time to kick off the boots and get to know each other better, huh?
Excuse me, my lord, but the Captain keeps ducking me when I ask him to talk about the Battle of Druckenwell.
He was on the command ship when Moff Broysc won the day. But won't talk about it. Maybe it bothers him that Boysc saved his neck.
Lieutenant Pierce wants to know what happened.
Tell him the truth, Quinn.
If that's an order, my lord, I'll oblige.
Broysc brought the fleet to the brink of annihilation and froze. I belayed his orders and turned the tide.
He took credit and had me court-martialed. Darth Baras salvaged my career and placed me on Balmorra.
I don't buy that. All these years later, he could say anything.
I'm sure Quinn's account is accurate.
I have no doubt.
I appreciate the vote of confidence, my lord.
Now, Lieutenant, return to your post.
Fine.
You will show Captain Quinn his due respect, Lieutenant.
At attention, Pierce!
Pierce, your disrespect for authority certainly keeps things lively around here.
Ah, spirited dissent.
Gotta keep the captain on his toes, make sure rigor mortis doesn't set in.
Just wanted to hear the details of one of the Empire's most glorious leaders. Maybe spur a little patriotic spirit around here.
Listen to me, Lieutenant. Moff Broysc brought the fleet to the brink of destruction.
I'll tell you the truth.
It was Quinn who rejected Broysc's orders and saved the day at Druckenwell.
According to who? Him?
I believe him, so you believe him. Is that clear?
According to me.
It is just your word, Quinn.
I suppose it could be false.
If I've given you cause to doubt me, my lord, I am most regretful.
But now I do suggest that the lieutenant return to his station.
I can live with that. My lord.
Enough meaningless squabbling.
This is a waste of time.
Might change his attitude, if you explained everything.
Why not enlighten him, Quinn?
I will not affirm his disregard for my authority by jumping through hoops.
He will follow orders. Or he will be discharged.
There's only one person who can send me away.
If you don't adhere to the chain of command, you compromise us all. And the captain determines such things.
Quinn is authorized.
Duly noted. My lord.
Back to your station then, Lieutenant.
Pierce isn't going anywhere. Deal with it.
That's right, Quinn.
I see. Very well, my lord.
I'll get back to my post now.
You two better find a way to coexist, or you'll both be gone.
Play nice, kids.
Who cares?
This is ancient history and military pettiness. Break it up and get back to work.
Yes, my lord.
Sure thing.
My lord, I'd appreciate it if you could speak with Vette. Ask her not to disturb me when I'm working.
Exactly how is she disturbing you?
What's she doing?
Aren't you supposed to run this ship, Captain? And the crew?
Can't you handle her?
She's not wired for military precision. And there's no filter on that Twi'lek mouth.
Just tune her out, Captain.
Ignore her.
That's like trying to ignore an inflamed rash. The chatter is non-stop.
When I was tracking down agent Voloren, she must have overheard me refer to Moff Broysc, and now she persistently pesters me about him.
She keeps slipping his name nonsensically into conversations just to annoy me. Says she won't stop until I tell her why I hate the man.
Vette's relentless. Once she gloms onto something, she doesn't let go. Best if you just tell her the story.
She's not going to stop.
Vette never ceases to amuse me.
Hilarious.
I hope you won't encourage her, my lord.
She wants to get to know you, Quinn. It wouldn't kill you to make friends.
She's just curious.
With her? My lord, please.
It's neither appropriate nor in the Empire's interest to discuss the matter with non-military personnel.
Besides, knowing her, the details of Broysc's collapse at Druckenwell and his and my subsequent conflict would only give her more fodder.
Leave it to me, she'll stop bothering you.
I'll talk to her.
I was hoping you'd say that, my lord. Thank you.
Your reluctance to talk about it makes me wonder if you've made the whole thing up.
Maybe your story isn't true.
If I've given you cause to doubt me, I am regretful.
In the interest of maintaining precise operations, I'll humor Vette.
Sorry to have bothered you.
You have my permission to handle her severely if you have to, Quinn.
Shut her up then.
I understand. It is my responsibility.
I will discipline her until she desists. My lord.
My lord, I'm back from my mission.
I'm pleased to report, Agent Voloren's decade of espionage has been brought to an end. It is a great day for the Empire.
It isn't every day you close the book on an old score.
Savor it.
It is long overdue.
Just another Republic spy. I'm sure there will be others.
"Great" is a bit much.
No doubt. But none that have caused the Empire such difficulty.
Tell me you took great joy in ending the spy's life.
I hope you killed him.
When he realized we was exposed, Voloren surrendered to me. I took him into custody.
Thank you for allowing me to pursue this, my lord.
You could drop the stoic soldier routine when we're in private. Show me a little attention.
[Flirt] So come closer to me.
I'm... not sure what you mean.
You and I could help each other unwind. Reduce stress. Live a little.
We can have fun.
I'm... flattered, my lord.
Don't tell me I'm not your type.
Don't you find me attractive?
Indeed, my lord, you are not a type at all. I dare say, you are a wholly unique woman.
But my work demands complete concentration, and I--well--I'm not used to juggling business with pleasure.
It's time to diversify, Captain.
Get used to it.
No lame excuses or explanations. If you're not interested, just say so.
Don't be gentle.
Don't presume that you know where I'm coming from, Captain. Or where I'm headed.
You misunderstand.
It's too easy to make you stammer, Captain. You better not pause like that in a life-and-death situation.
Never mind. You're so obtuse.
I'm never at a loss in the heat of battle, my lord.
For your sake, I hope not.
That had better be true.
It's not the heat of battle I'm worried about.
There are other kinds of heat.
You've worn out your welcome, Captain.
You're tiresome.
I value your constant professionalism and expertise, Quinn.
You're appreciated.
Thank you, my lord.
Don't make more out of it than it was, Captain.
It wasn't that important.
You're very gracious, my lord.
I expect your eyes and mind to be firmly occupied in my charge now.
Refocus on my objectives.
I'll become doubly dedicated.
Is there anything you require at this time?
It wouldn't kill you to smile once in a while. Or would it?
[Flirt] A little tone change.
I will try to do that for you.
I look forward to your attempts.
Good.
Hope the effort won't break your face.
Don't strain yourself.
If it's so unnatural that it takes effort, never mind.
Forget it.
Carry on, Captain.
All is well.
My enemies defeated.
Victory.
We're working on that, my lord.
Some peace and quiet.
Just silence.
Now, let's get back to our duties.
By all means, my lord.
My lord, my efforts to locate SIS Agent Voloren have finally paid off. There is a small window of opportunity to confront him.
I can handle the matter personally; permission to intercept and bring him down?
By all means.
All Imperial concerns sound the same to me. Refresh my memory.
What are you talking about?
Voloren is the SIS agent I would have caught years ago, but Moff Broysc unwittingly stopped me.
This agent continues to cause the Empire untold losses. I've finally tracked him down, my lord.
He's scheduled for extraction. If that happens the trail will be lost, and all the intel he's acquired will be compromised.
You can't let that happen.
There's no time to waste. He must finally be stopped.
I appreciate your decisiveness, my lord.
This brings your priorities into question, Quinn.
This is a trifling matter.
Your missions are priority one, my lord. My duties here are complete, and this won't take long.
This is personal for you.
So, your vendetta begins.
I'm sure you're pleased to begin your campaign to pay back Moff Broysc.
My lord, this isn't personal. I seek the good of the Empire only.
You'll see, vengeance is sweet, Quinn.
Revenge will wake you up.
Such motives suit you. Duty is all I need.
Just admit it, you hate this Moff who ruined your glory.
You can't fool me.
Hate is unnecessary. Duty is motivation enough.
You'd be so much more attractive, if you'd let your vindictive side show.
[Flirt] Embrace your anger.
I'll take it under advisement, my lord.
Knowing you, Quinn, that's probably the extent of it.
I stand corrected.
The Empire will finally be served. I'll return shortly.
My lord, I have been working on something in my spare time. You may be interested.
Your duties should keep you eternally busy.
What spare time?
My responsibilities to you are always handled first.
Let me be the judge of that.
I'll decide.
Right away.
Go ahead, regale me.
I'm all ears.
Years ago, I was zeroing in on a notorious SIS agent called Voloren when Moff Broysc recalled me to the Battle of Druckenwell.
I had the spy cornered. I briefed Broysc so that he could send someone else to take Voloren out. He ignored the opportunity.
What is so important about this Voloren?
Tell me about this spy.
Over the years, he has single-handedly caused more damage to the Empire than any other Republic operative.
One missed opportunity has led to a decade of unnecessary losses.
This sounds like a personal vendetta.
I sense emotion in you, Quinn.
I'll admit, knowing how close I was to ending his career made languishing on Balmorra all the more frustrating.
But I take this on only for the good of the Empire. This spy has caused immeasurable losses.
This Moff is starting to sound like a chronic screwup.
Another Moff Broysc mistake?
That is not for me to determine. I will say this, though....
Since then, Voloren has gone on to wreak havoc against the Empire. One missed opportunity has led to a decade of unnecessary losses.
I know Voloren's signature, and by tracking his accomplishments, I've picked up his scent.
It is imperative that you track him down.
Find him.
Very good, my lord.
I don't want to notice even a slight drop in your proficiency. Am I understood?
This is a secondary concern.
You will see no change in my focus, my lord.
Follow your little Imperial pursuits as you see fit.
Nice to have a hobby.
I'll keep you abreast of my progress.
Permission to speak freely, my lord?
Go ahead, Captain.
Granted.
You may always speak freely, Quinn.
You don't need permission.
I'll keep that in mind.
Fine, but don't annoy me and make it brief.
If you must.
Yes, my lord.
There's a reason I was languishing on Balmorra before you arrived. A decade ago, I served under Moff Broysc at the Battle of Druckenwell.
Moff Broysc made a critical oversight that brought the fleet to the brink of complete defeat. I ignored his order and turned the tide to victory.
I take it the Moff took exception to that.
And Broysc punished you.
Your intuition is flawless, my lord.
Then you are to be commended.
Good for you.
That's not how the Moff saw it.
Do you make a habit of disregarding the chain of command?
You defied a superior?
Not in the least, my lord. I implored Broysc but he was blind, and the consequences of doing nothing would have been too great.
Broysc took credit for the reversal, which is fine, but he then court-martialed me.
Darth Baras assigned me to Balmorra or my career would have been over. Moff Broysc has blocked every transfer and promotion I've been up for since.
I have no tolerance for fools like this Moff.
Broysc sounds like an idiot.
I could say more about him, my lord, but my point is made.
Defying authority is the fastest route to stagnation. Remember that.
That's what you get.
Your advice is noted, my lord.
It must have served Baras to keep you on Balmorra. Clearly, he was capable of advancing you.
Baras could have helped you.
Well, I--I suppose you're right. But I was grateful to be wearing the uniform and helping an important Sith.
I serve you now, I have no regrets.
I'll return to my duties.
You wished to speak?
Yes, my lord. I wanted to update you on the condition of your ship. It has responded extremely well to my optimizations.
I'm pleased to report that we are operating at peak efficiency.
In the future, do not interrupt me. I will assume such information unless I hear otherwise.
You're wasting my time.
Oh. Yes, my lord, I won't occupy you with routine updates.
But I encourage suggestions.
I will accept no less, Captain.
It had better be.
Of course, my lord. There will be no slippage.
I'm glad to hear it. Keep up the good work.
Well done.
I fully intend to, my lord.
Let's not waste any more time.
Now, back to work.
As you decree.
Your demeanor makes me tense, Captain, work on loosening up.
And try to relax.
I see. Actually, my lord, I don't see. Is that an order or are you testing my professionalism?
I don't make requests, Quinn. Consider everything out of my mouth to be mandatory.
It's an order.
Then I will do my best to--uh--loosen up.
You're a lost cause. Never mind.
Forget it.
Sorry to have disappointed you.
I'm going to get a kick out of you.
You're amusing.
I hope to be of greater service than that, my lord.
And I encourage suggestions.
If there are deficiencies you see or suggestions you have about my operations and missions, I want you to speak up.
I will make such things clearly known.
You can count on me.
My lord, I request an audience when we return to the ship.
My lord, when you are available, I request an audience.
There will be time to update you later, my lord.
I'm counting on it.
You've made me very happy, my lord.
Never mind. You can call me whatever you like. I'll respond in kind.
It just worked out that way, I guess. But I'll live.
My lord, the new alluvial dampers have been installed and the hyperdrive tested to my satisfaction.
This ship is now the most hyper speed-ready vessel in the galaxy.
This is just the beginning, my lord.
I will tirelessly work toward improving this ship and the effectiveness of everyone in it.
When you are ready, say the word.
I'll stop crowing, my lord. But know that I won't stop working toward improving this ship and the effectiveness of everyone in it.
Awaiting your next order.
Not exactly. There's much I wish to communicate to you, but I'm waiting for a moment of privacy.
You'll find I'm far from squeamish now.
My, lord I have taken it upon myself to look into something of importance.
You have a great sense of humor, my lord. If I wasn't on duty, I'd allow myself a good laugh.
New generation hyperdrive support tech is being developed. The Empire is negotiating for exclusive purchasing rights. But it could take months to be available.
I've been saving my commission and was able to pull strings to acquire the latest alluvial dampers. For your ship.
I did an exhaustive cost analysis, and this is by far the most sensible use of my pay.
What do they do?
Alluvial dampers regulate the flow of ion particles into the hyperdrive to help keep it from overheating.
It will benefit us all, my lord.
These dampers are so efficient, they reduce the system's refractory period by thirty-two-point-nine percent.
Once I have them installed, we'll be able to make successive light speed jumps with one-third less waiting time.
Excellent.
They are a thing of great precision.
Pathetic use of your credits.
Service is my life, my lord. Surely by now you know that.
So, get on with it.
I'll get right to work.
I've held back long enough. Been too rigid, too inflexible. I won't suppress my feelings and desires any longer.
Come with me to my quarters and I'll show you.
That's more like it.
Come with me to my quarters. I'll show you how I feel.
Absolutely.
You are a very difficult woman to understand.
You'll find me no longer willing to play this cat and mouse game.
My feelings are real, so I'll bear this a bit longer. But there will be a limit, no matter what you threaten.
That's as clear as can be, my lord. I will snap too immediately.
I won't be deterred.
I'm glad we got that settled.
I feel no conflict over my actions. Broysc was a blight on the Empire.
You are guiding me to a new paradigm, my lord. One a bit more improvisational. I believe it will only make me a better officer.
I will not disappoint you, my lord.
I await your judgment.
Of course, my lord.
I abducted him. He's in the cargo hold.
It felt good to confront him after all these years. And to subdue him.
I admit, it felt good to confront him. And to subdue him.
But my training is difficult to overcome. He's still a superior officer. I need the execution order to come directly from you.
As you command, my lord.
You're right. That man is the cause of so much needless loss.
But more than that, he betrayed me. And I will see him dead!
Very well. I'll clean up after you.
Thank you for seeing this through.
It seems clear. I must deal with Broysc myself. Once and for all.
Rodjnik is his communications officer. This is how it's been.
I can resist you no longer....
My lord, your captain there is one in a million. I'd given up hope anyone out there would hear my distress calls.
Your success is my reward.
Lead the way, my lord.
Awaiting your next order.
Whatever you wish, my lord.
I'll be right here if needed, my lord.
An opportunity is all I ask.
Yes, my lord.
Service is its own reward.
You are my general, I will back you up.
I won't disappoint, my lord.
I'm ready, my lord.
Right away, my lord.
When you are ready, say the word.
I will assist you any way possible in the battle to come.
If my talents can be of help, I hope you will utilize them.
